abstract: Vulcan Capital, the venture-capital vehicle of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen, is creating a joint venture with Bankers’ Capital Group to look for investments in the banking sector in the southeast United States. Bankers’ Capital was launched last year by a group of executives that cleaned up troubled bank Flag Financial and sold it to RBC Centura, the Financial News reports.
lead_paragraph: Vulcan Capital, the venture-capital vehicle of Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen, is creating a joint venture with Bankers’ Capital Group to look for investments in the banking sector in the southeast United States. Bankers’ Capital was launched last year by a group of executives that cleaned up troubled bank Flag Financial and sold it to RBC Centura, the Financial News reports.

headline.main: Paul Allen’s Firm to Seek Banking Investments

abstract: More by David Pogue on the early attempts to bridge the gulf between computer and TV.
snippet: More by David Pogue on the early attempts to bridge the gulf between computer and TV.
lead_paragraph: Today in The Times, I reviewed the Apple TV box--and, for context, a couple of its rivals from Microsoft and Netgear.

headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue
